titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John W. Clinedinst papers, 1892-1955
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters, postcards, financial papers, photographs, and memorial card relating to his business and personal life. Includes orders for buggies (1909-1913) and a letter (1909) from Washington photographer Barnett M. Clinedinst.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: John W. Clinedinst Papers, 1892-1955, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: John W. Clinedinst was a carriage and wagon builder of New Market, Shenandoah County, Va.; brother of photographer Barnet M. Clinedinst; and the uncle of artist Benjamin West Clinedinst.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters, postcards, financial papers, photographs, and memorial card relating to his business and personal life. Includes orders for buggies (1909-1913) and a letter (1909) from Washington photographer Barnett M. Clinedinst.
